data.title: Madeleine: Name Meaning, Origin, History, And Popularity
data.meta_description: Madeleine is a modern archival name influenced by an eminent and noble character from the Bible. Read on to learn more about this interesting name.
data.text:
In This Article

Origin, Meaning, And History of Madeleine

The baby name Madeline is a French and English term that originates from the Greek word Magdalene, meaning ‚Äòof Magdala German.‚Äô Magdala was the name of a Jewish city by Galilee‚Äôs seashore. It could also mean ‚Äòan elevated tower.‚Äô In German, Madeleine also means little girls, taken from the word M√§delein.

This name is associated with Saint Mary Magdalene of Galilee, one of Jesus‚Äôs followers in the New Testament, a title meaning ‚Äòof Magdala.‚Äô She was named so because she hailed from the village of Magdala, which in turn meant ‚Äòtower.‚Äô Saint Mary Magdalene is the ‚Äúapostle of apostles‚Äù and is believed to have been the closest disciple of Jesus, who deeply understood the Gnostic texts. She was an independent and empathetic disciple who supported His ministry with her wealth of knowledge and riches. In addition, she was known for her leadership qualities, such as determination and her passion for serving mankind.

According to the canonical gospels, Saint Magdalene witnessed the crucifixion and resurrection of Jesus Christ, thus gaining some of the most mentions in the four gospels. In addition, the Catholic, Eastern Orthodox, Anglican, Lutheran, and Protestant churches consider her a saint and heroine of the faith.

The name has several spelling variations in different cultures and languages. Some of them are Magdalena in German, Magdalen, Madeleine, Magdalena, and Madeline in English, Magdalena and Magdalina in Bulgarian, Malene, Magdalena, Magda, Lena in Danish, and Madalena and Magda in Portuguese. The bynames associated with Madeleine include Maddy, Maddie, Leine, Alena, Lena, Lene, Leni, Magda, and Lena.

There are several popular fictional characters with the name Madeleine. Some of them include Madeline from Ludwig Bemelmans‚Äô children‚Äôs book series, Madeline ‚ÄúMaddy‚Äù Whittier of Nicola Yoon‚Äôs novel ‚ÄúEverything, Everything,‚Äù Madeline Mackenzie, the main character in the limited T.V. series ‚ÄúBig Little Lies,‚Äù Madeline ‚ÄúMads‚Äù Ryback, the daughter of Alec in the T.V. show ‚ÄúThe Lying Game,‚Äù Madeleine Hanna, the star of Jeffrey Eugenides‚Äô 2011 book ‚ÄúThe Marriage Plot,‚Äù and Madeline Wayne, the main character of the American sitcom ‚ÄúOh Madeline.‚Äù

Notable People Named Madeleine

This section covers people who have made the name Madeleine famous with their contributions in various fields. It indeed is a little more inspiration for you to choose the name for your baby, don‚Äôt you think?

Madeleine AlbrightPolitician and diplomat

Madeleine StoweActress

Madeleine L'EngleWriter

Madeleine PeyrouxSinger-songwriter

Madeline ManningAn American track and field athlete and Olympic gold medalist during the 1968 Mexico Olympics

Madeline StuartA famous Australian model with down syndrome and an advocate of the disability community

Madeline AndersonThe first African-American producer and director of a TV documentary and a syndicated TV series

Madeleine On The Popularity Chart

According to the U.S. Social Security Administration charts, Madeleine gained steady popularity after 1985, with slight dips in the graph. Explore the graphs below for better insights.

Popularity Over Time

The popularity of this name rose from 54 babies per million in 1980 to 1424 babies per million in 1998. After this point, it has seen an erratic pattern in popularity.

Source:

Rank Over Time

Madeleine was ranked in 1970 in 1980. The rank dropped in the year 1982 but has been increasing steadily since.

Source:

Popularity Within US States

If you're living in the US, you might be curious about the popularity of Madeleine in your own state, a state you're considering moving to, or one with which you have a connection. Use the drop-down menu below to select any US state and discover the name's popularity within that region.

California

Texas

Florida

Source:

Madeleine Name‚Äôs Presence On Social Media

Before you finalize your baby‚Äôs name, you would want to assess if the name is rare or popular. Digital footprint of the name - it‚Äôs presence on the internet and social media platforms - can provide you with valuable insights on it‚Äôs popularity. A name‚Äôs online presence is an important metric for new parents to evaluate their options and make an informed choice. How many people are searching the name on Google, how many profiles are there on Facebook, does the name have a Wikipedia page? Such information surely tells you if the name is ubiquitous or unique. Here is how Madeleine fares on that count.

Madeleine‚Äôs Zodiac Sign As Per Western Astrology

Western astrology includes the construction of a horoscope based on the person‚Äôs exact time of birth and location to understand the positions of the planet, stars, and zodiac signs at that time. However, in popular culture, it is often narrowed down to the sun sign, which depends on the person‚Äôs birth date.There are 12 zodiac signs, each having dominant traits, planetary rulers, elemental connection, and more.

Zodiac sign or Sun sign

The Earth‚Äôs orbit around the sun is divided into 12 zodiac signs covering 30-degree sectors. According to Western astrology, the zodiac or sun sign depends on the sun‚Äôs position in one of these sectors at the time of your birth. Starting from the sun‚Äôs position at the March equinox, the chart goes anti-clockwise from Aries, followed by Taurus, Gemini, Cancer, Leo, Virgo, Libra, Scorpio, Sagittarius, Capricorn, Aquarius, and Pisces. These signs are ruled by planetary bodies - Mars, Venus, Mercury, Moon, Sun, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune. Furthermore, they are categorized into triplicities or elemental signs - fire, water, air, and earth - that govern their characteristics. Each of these zodiac signs features certain personality traits that may determine how a person presents themselves.

Each zodiac sign in Western astrology is linked to a specific range of dates in the year. Unlike Vedic astrology, where names can sometimes be used to infer astrological details, Western astrology relies entirely on the birth date.

To know more about your baby‚Äôs zodiac sign, choose the period in which your baby‚Äôs date of birth falls, from the options given below. This will give you a glimpse into the world of astrology tailored for your baby.

Madeleine‚Äôs Zodiac Sign And Birth Star As Per Vedic Astrology

Madeleine Personality Traits As Per Numerology

The numerology belief system envisages a relationship between a name and numbers. The related numbers are believed to give insights into a person‚Äôs character. We have researched this area to connect the numerology-based characteristic traits to the letters of the English alphabet. And the results are fascinating.

Numerology followers believe that each letter signifies attributes that can influence a person‚Äôs attitude and approach. Among these placements, the most significant are the first letter (Cornerstone) and the last letter (Capstone) of a name. Cornerstone highlights your primary personality traits and explains how you face challenges and opportunities in life. Capstone can tell you about your approach to work and how you complete them. Often, a letter may be repeated twice or more in a name. This repetition signifies the intensification or amplification of the traits associated with the letter in an individual‚Äôs personality.

Read to know what characteristics the name Madeleine is known for in numerology. Here we have avoided repetition of letters and added them just once for a better reading experience.

Infographic: Know The Name Madeleine‚Äòs Personality As Per Numerology
